synth.name: Volca Drum

steps: Tap the instrument/part to edit (button 1–6)
Tap <synth-button>Edit/Step</synth-button>
Tap <synth-button>Accent</synth-button>
Tap any of the 16 pads to add/remove accents
While holding one of the 16 pads, the <synth-knob>Level</synth-knob> knob can adjust the amount of accent
Accent Steps.notes: Note that an accent may be placed where there is no trigger, so be sure you have triggered the instrument at the step you are accenting

steps: Tap the instrument/part to edit (button 1–6)
Tap <synth-button>Edit/Step</synth-button>
Turn <synth-knob>Select (Param)</synth-knob> to choose which aspect to modify
Turn <synth-knob>Level</synth-knob> to change the value
Bit Reduction, Fold, Drive, Pan, Gain.notes: These parameters are per instrument/track and not per layer

steps: Hold down <synth-button>Function</synth-button> and press <synth-button narrow>8</synth-button>
Tap instrument / part 1–6 to add that part to the choke group
Tap any key to exit this mode
Choke Groups.notes: When two parts in the choke group are playing, the lowest will have priority

steps: Tap instrument / part 1–6 to copy from
Hold down <synth-button>Function</synth-button> and press <synth-button narrow>7</synth-button> to enter copy mode
Tap instrument / part 1–6 to copy to
Hold down <synth-button>Function</synth-button> and press 12 until the light is on (this enabled motion recording)
Press <synth-button>▶️</synth-button> to start playback
Tap instrument / part 1–6 to record motion for
Press <synth-button>⏺</synth-button> and move clear knobs
Motion Recording.notes: After one cycle of the sequence completes, motion recording will stop. You will need to time it right.

steps: Hold down <synth-button>Mute</synth-button>
Tap the instrument/part to mute or unmute (button 1–6)
Tap the instrument/part to edit (button 1–6)
Tap <synth-button>Act Step</synth-button>
Tap buttons 1–16 to turn on/off that step during playback
Tap the instrument/part to edit (button 1–6)
Tap <synth-button>Edit/Step</synth-button>
Hold a pad (1–16), then turn <synth-knob>Level</synth-knob> to adjust the probability
Tap the instrument/part to edit (button 1–6)
Tap <synth-button>Edit/Step</synth-button>
Tap <synth-button>Slice</synth-button>
Tap any of the 16 pads to add/remove ratchets
Hold a selected pad, then turn <synth-knob>Level</synth-knob> to adjust the number of repeated triggers
Ratchet or Flam Steps.notes: Note that an accent may be placed where there is no trigger, so be sure you have triggered the instrument at the step you are accenting

steps: Turn off Volca
Hold down <synth-button>⏺</synth-button> and turn Volca on
To set single-channel mode, tap one of the 1–16 buttons to set the channel
Tap the lit channel to disable all channels and configure split channel mode
Tap <synth-button>⏺</synth-button> to save the selection
Tap <synth-button>▶️</synth-button> to abort the change
Set MIDI Channel & Mode.notes: In split channel mode, instrument / part 1–6 respond on MIDI channels 1–6, respectively.

steps: Press <synth-button>▶️</synth-button> to start playback
Tap <synth-button>Step Jump</synth-button> to enter step jump mode
Tap the step on pad 1–16 to repeat all triggers on that step as <sup>1</sup>⁄<sub>16</sub> notes
Release the pad to resume normal playback
Tap <synth-button>Step Jump</synth-button> to exit step jump mode
Tap the instrument/part to edit (button 1–6)
Tap <synth-button>Edit/Step</synth-button>
Tap any of the 16 pads to add/remove triggers

notes: Waveguide send is per instrument, not per layer
Swing moves even steps 0-75% backward. Hold <synth-button>Func</synth-button> while turning to move forward
